alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... Although the rhetoric about science is that ideas count, not who expresses them, in practice ideas are commonly judged by their source. Ideas are given much more credibility if they come from a respectable source. Outsiders face an uphill battle."

- Strategies for Dissenting Scientists, Brian Martin, Science and Technology Studies, University of Wollongong, NSW 2522, Australia
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Challenging the System - Part 2
